content.title: Top Class Education For Students With Disabilities
content.department: Ministry Of Social Justice and Empowerment
content.details: A scholarship scheme by DoEPwDs for Students with Disabilities (SwDs) pursuing studies beyond class 12th admitted in a full-time course in one of the 'notified institutions'. The students with the specified disabilities defined in Schedule of the 'Rights of Persons with Disabilities Act, 2016' will be eligible under this scheme. This includes persons with visual, hearing, speech, loco-motor, mental retardation, and other disabilities. The scheme aims to support SwDs to study further in order to prepare themselves to earn their livelihood and to find a dignified place for themselves in society.
benefits: Payment of Full tuition fee and non-refundable charges (Ceiling of Rs. 2.00 LPA per student for private sector institutions)
Living expenses: ₹ 3000/- per month per student.
Books and stationery: ₹ 5000/- per annum per student.
A computer/laptop with accessories (UPS and printer) is limited to ₹ 30,000/- per student (one-time assistance).

Reimbursement of expenses for the purchase of Aids and Assistive Devices including necessary software related to the particular disability of the selected candidate: ₹ 30,000/- per student (one-time assistance).
Special Allowance (related to types of disabilities like Reader Allowance, Escort Allowance, Helper Allowance etc.): ₹ 2000/- per month.
eligibility: The applicant should be a Student admitted in a full-time course in one of the 'notified institutions'.
The Percentage of Disability should be 40% or above.
The applicant should be Pursuing a Graduate or Post Graduate Degree or Diploma.
The Total Annual Income of the Parent / Guardian should be less than or equal to ₹ 6.00 Lakh per Annum.
The applicant MUST NOT be the third sibling in his/her family who is availing of this scholarship.
exclusions: Not more than two children with disabilities of the same parents will be entitled to receive the benefits of the scheme.
If a student is found to have obtained a scholarship by false statements, his/her scholarship will be cancelled forthwith.
If the scholar changes the subject of the course of study for which the scholarship was originally awarded unless such change in course has been approved by DEPwD.
If a student has to repeat a class, he/she would not get any scholarship for that class for a second (or subsequent) year.
documents_required: Self-attested Degree/Mark Sheet of the last qualifying exam.
Bank Details of the applicant or of the Parent/Guardian.
Bonafide Student Certificate from the school/institute.
Recent colour photograph of the candidate.
Certificate of Disability (issued by a competent authority).
Declaration Certificate (issued by HoD or competent authority of the university or institute).

faqs.question: Am I eligible for this scholarship if two of my siblings are availing the benefits of this scheme?
faqs.answer: No. You won’t be eligible in this case.

faqs.question: How will my tuition fee and non-refundable charges be paid?
faqs.answer: The payment will be made directly to the institution.

faqs.question: Is there a validity to the scheme benefits?
faqs.answer: The benefits are provided till the complete duration of the course.

faqs.question: What would be the mode of payment of the scholarship?
faqs.answer: The payment of the scholarship will be through Direct Benefit Transfer (DBT).

faqs.question: Will I be eligible for the scholarship if I fail to get promoted to the next semester?
faqs.answer: No. The scholarship will be terminated in that case.

faqs.question: Is there any application fee?
faqs.answer: No. The entire application process is completely free of cost.
